basic.description: This course analyzes the international business environment and surveys managerial issues associated with international operations.  Module 1. focuses on the global environment, including the institutions of globalization - the WTO, IMF, European Union etc.  Module 2. examines how firms operate in this environment.  Specifically we study how strategy, marketing, accounting, finance, operations and human resources are affected by geography and culture. Each module includes a project assignment aimed at developing familiarity with international economic information and news sources, in print and on the Internet. (Lead Instructor: James Tiesson, McMaster)
